search_results.title: Robert Fulton - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Robert Fulton (November 14, 1765  February 24, 1815) was an American engineer and inventor who is widely credited with developing a commercially successful steamboat called Clermont. That steamboat went with passengers from New York City to Albany and back again, a round trip of 300 miles, in 62 hours in 1807.
